questions.text: Who offered to watch Carla's children?
questions.explanation:
Cliff.

	Carla had a date and needed someone to watch her children and finally agreed to let Cliff do it. Cliff didn't realize how difficult it would be.

Frasier and Lilith.

	When they told Sam he said, "Right here in the bar?" Frasier thought he didn't know what cohabitating meant, but it turned out he was just making a joke.

questions.text: What kind of bear did Lilith call Frasier?
questions.explanation:
cinnamon bear.

	Cinnamon bear was her pet name for Frasier in this episode. At this point Lilith was becoming a regular guest star on "Cheers".

questions.text: How did Frasier arrange the magazines?
questions.explanation:
in an accordion fashion.

	Lilith did not like this and they started to argue. They made up before Sam and Diane arrived but they fought again throughout the episode.

questions.text: Why did Frasier need Lilith's help?
questions.correct: Sam and Diane weren't very good conversationalists.
options: He needed help make the dinner.
questions.explanation:
Sam and Diane weren't very good conversationalists.

	At this point Lilith had locked herself in the bathroom. Frasier managed to get in to the bathroom where he could be heard yelling at Lilith to get back out in the living room.

"Our House".

	"Our House" is a Crosby, Stills and Nash song. Lilith and Frasier started to sing, but then they stop when Diane tried to join in.

questions.correct: He was once engaged to Diane.
options: He didn't want to live with her.
He was in love with Carla.
questions.explanation:
He was once engaged to Diane.

	When Lilith heard this news she got upset and locked herself in the bathroom once again. Frasier informed her that he didn't tell her because he wanted to forget it since it was such a horrible thing in his past.

questions.text: After Lilith, who was the next person to lock him/herself in the bathroom?
questions.explanation:
Frasier.

	Lilith kept asking Frasier all these questions and he couldn't take it anymore. He said, "I will not be drilled like a common criminal" and then locked himself in the bathroom.

questions.text: What did the note on Cliff say?
questions.explanation:
"Don't open until Christmas".

	Carla's kids made Cliff into a package and dropped him off at Cheers. Woody read the note and was upset that he had to wait till Christmas to open it.

questions.text: When Diane said "Our relationship was a two-way street," how did Frasier respond?
questions.correct: "I was run over in both directions."
options: "And I loved every minute of it."
questions.explanation:
"I was run over in both directions."

	Frasier still was not totally over being jilted by Diane at the alter. He felt like his relationship with her was horrible.
